div.p: RBG Kew, Kew correspondence, Australia, Mueller, 1858-70, un-numbered folio after f. 95.

I have to send a brief reply to your last letter
J. Hooker to M, 24 December 1862. Your acknowledging the validity of Macropteranthes in Combretaceae is very pleasing to me. I send a new (i.e. third) species found during Stuarts last expedition. I named after Stuarts principal Officer, who seems to have gathered some of the plants of Stuarts expedition.
M named Macropteranthes kekwickii in B63.04.01, p. 151, to honour W. D. Kekwick, second in command of John McDouall Stuart's expedition of 1861-2. He had been promoted second in command during an earlier expedition. See Threadgill (1922). — I feel much obliged for your generosity of continuing your contributions towards our herbarium. Thanks to your goodness and that [after] equally well-meaning friends we have now accumulated already a very valuable herbarium of extra-Australian plants, important for comparisons, especially when we are able to trust so implicitly on their correct naming, which we can in all that comes from Kew. — I trust that the woods are now all safely lodged at Kew and that the specimens were not curtailed.
Specimens exhibited at the International Exhibition, London, 1862.

I shall be happy to leave drawing up the description of the new grass to Colonel Munro, who will have a ready opportunity of introducing it into one of your periodicals.
See postscript to J. Hooker to M, 24 December 1862.

div.p:
Pray give my best thanks to your venerable father for having sent me the completing numbers of the 4. vol of his admirable Genera filicum.
W. Hooker (1842).
All ours shall go for inspection to Kew by next opportunity. Since you always show so much solicitious interest in what concerns me, it will be probably pleasing to you to hear, that the Emperor of France has condescended of conferring on me the Knighthood of the Legion of Honor.
See Ordre Impérial de la Légion d’Honneur to M, 6 January 1863 (in this edition as 63-01-06a); E. Drouyn de Lhuys to M, 6 January 1863; and M to H. Barkly, 23 March 1863 (in this edition as 63-03-23c).
